intro: Laurus purpurea, commonly known as the purple laurel, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves that turn a striking purple hue in the autumn. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers followed by dark blue berries. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and aromatic foliage. Laurus purpurea is relatively hardy and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun.
